back_cards.definition_en: Something that is unknown or unexplained.
back_cards.example_en: The old house holds a mystery we can’t solve.

back_cards.definition_en: A story or puzzle involving secrets.
back_cards.example_en: I love reading a good mystery novel.

back_cards.definition_en: An event or situation that’s unclear.
back_cards.example_en: Her sudden absence is a complete mystery.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of intrigue or enigma.
back_cards.example_en: The painting’s meaning remains a mystery.
The scientist unraveled the mystery of the disease.

back_cards.definition_en: A contest to determine a champion.
back_cards.example_en: The team won the basketball championship.

back_cards.definition_en: The title of being the best in a sport.
back_cards.example_en: She’s aiming for the national championship.
The championship game is on TV tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of winning a top prize.
back_cards.example_en: Their championship was a huge upset.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of games to decide a winner.
back_cards.example_en: The chess championship lasted three days.

back_cards.definition_en: To set up or put something in place.
back_cards.example_en: They’ll install new lights in the kitchen.

back_cards.definition_en: To add software to a computer.
back_cards.example_en: I need to install the latest update.

back_cards.definition_en: To place someone in a position.
back_cards.example_en: The new mayor was installed last week.
He installed a security system at home.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish or set up for use.
back_cards.example_en: They installed solar panels on the roof.

back_cards.definition_en: A story, often fictional or imaginative.
back_cards.example_en: She told a tale about a magical forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrative or account of events.
back_cards.example_en: His tale of adventure captivated the kids.
The old tale of the dragon is famous.
Grandpa shared tales from his youth.
That’s quite a tale about your fishing trip!
She values her liberty to make choices.
The statue symbolizes liberty for all.
He took the liberty of borrowing my book.
Voting is a liberty we should cherish.
The revolution fought for liberty.
The cat hid beneath the couch.
She felt beneath her boss in the meeting.
Treasure was buried beneath the sand.
Such behavior is beneath her character.
The keys were found beneath the rug.

back_cards.definition_en: A person traveling in a vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: The bus was full of passengers.
She’s just a passenger in the carpool.

back_cards.definition_en: A traveler on a plane or ship.
back_cards.example_en: All passengers must board by 6 PM.

back_cards.definition_en: A person along for the ride.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a frequent passenger on this train.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone carried by a mode of transport.
back_cards.example_en: The ferry carried 200 passengers today.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical doctor who treats illnesses.
back_cards.example_en: The physician prescribed medicine for her cough.
She’s a physician specializing in cardiology.

back_cards.definition_en: A doctor who diagnoses and treats.
back_cards.example_en: The physician examined the patient thoroughly.
He’s been a physician for 20 years.
The physician advised rest and hydration.

back_cards.definition_en: To complete a course or degree.
back_cards.example_en: She’ll graduate from college next spring.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who has earned a degree.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a recent graduate looking for work.

back_cards.definition_en: To move to a higher level or stage.
back_cards.example_en: They graduate to advanced classes soon.
The graduates celebrated with a big party.

back_cards.definition_en: To achieve a milestone or certification.
back_cards.example_en: He graduated from the training program.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a fine edge or point.
back_cards.example_en: This knife is sharp enough to cut meat.
Her sharp mind solves problems fast.

back_cards.definition_en: Sudden or abrupt, like a turn.
back_cards.example_en: The car made a sharp turn.

back_cards.definition_en: Clear or distinct, like an image.
back_cards.example_en: The photo has a sharp, crisp look.
He looked sharp in his new suit.

back_cards.definition_en: A material or matter with specific properties.
back_cards.example_en: The substance in the vial was tested.
His argument lacks substance and evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: A drug or chemical, often harmful.
back_cards.example_en: The athlete tested positive for a banned substance.
The substance was sticky and hard to clean.
Her speech had real substance and impact.

back_cards.definition_en: The air or gases surrounding a planet.
back_cards.example_en: The Earth’s atmosphere protects us from radiation.

back_cards.definition_en: The mood or vibe of a place.
back_cards.example_en: The restaurant has a cozy atmosphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A layer of air around something.
back_cards.example_en: The atmosphere in the room felt tense.
The festival’s atmosphere was lively and fun.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense or tone of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: Her speech created an atmosphere of hope.

back_cards.definition_en: To mix something by moving it.
back_cards.example_en: Stir the soup so it doesn’t burn.
His speech stirred the crowd’s emotions.
The leaves stirred in the breeze.
She stirred the batter until it was smooth.
The news stirred debate among the group.

back_cards.definition_en: A follower of the Islamic faith.
back_cards.example_en: The Muslim community gathered for prayer.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the religion of Islam.
back_cards.example_en: Muslim traditions include fasting during Ramadan.
He’s a Muslim who prays five times daily.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to Islamic culture or beliefs.
back_cards.example_en: The museum displayed Muslim art.

back_cards.definition_en: An adherent of the Islamic religion.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a Muslim and studies the Quran.

back_cards.definition_en: A section of text or writing.
back_cards.example_en: I read a passage from the novel.

back_cards.definition_en: A way through or a path.
back_cards.example_en: The passage through the cave was narrow.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of passing or traveling.
back_cards.example_en: The passage of time healed her grief.
The passage across the ocean was rough.
The passage led to the main room.

back_cards.definition_en: A spice used to season food.
back_cards.example_en: Add some pepper to the soup for flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: A vegetable, like a bell pepper.
back_cards.example_en: She stuffed the peppers with rice.
He peppered his speech with jokes.

back_cards.definition_en: A seasoning for taste or heat.
back_cards.example_en: Black pepper is my favorite spice.

back_cards.definition_en: To bombard or shower with something.
back_cards.example_en: The team was peppered with questions.

back_cards.definition_en: To give special importance to something.
back_cards.example_en: She emphasized the need for teamwork.

back_cards.definition_en: To stress or highlight a point.
back_cards.example_en: He emphasized safety during the training.
The teacher emphasized the key vocabulary.

back_cards.definition_en: To focus attention on an idea.
back_cards.example_en: The report emphasizes reducing waste.

back_cards.definition_en: To underline or reinforce a message.
back_cards.example_en: They emphasized honesty in their values.

back_cards.definition_en: A thick wire or rope for support.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge is held up by strong cables.

back_cards.definition_en: A wire for transmitting electricity or signals.
back_cards.example_en: The cable for my charger is frayed.

back_cards.definition_en: A service for TV or internet.
back_cards.example_en: We just switched to a new cable provider.

back_cards.definition_en: A bundle of wires for connectivity.
back_cards.example_en: The cable connects the modem to the router.
The ship’s anchor cable was heavy.

back_cards.definition_en: A shape with four equal sides.
back_cards.example_en: The table is a perfect square.

back_cards.definition_en: An open public area in a city.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s meet in the town square.

back_cards.definition_en: To multiply a number by itself.
back_cards.example_en: Five squared is twenty-five.

back_cards.definition_en: Fair or honest, often in dealings.
back_cards.example_en: He’s always square in his business deals.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for measuring right angles.
back_cards.example_en: Use a square to check the corners.
This recipe for cookies is so easy.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of ingredients and steps.
back_cards.example_en: She shared her grandma’s pie recipe.

back_cards.definition_en: A method or formula for success.
back_cards.example_en: Hard work is her recipe for success.

back_cards.definition_en: A guide for cooking or baking.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for fresh herbs.

back_cards.definition_en: A plan or approach to achieve something.
back_cards.example_en: His recipe for happiness is simple living.

back_cards.definition_en: A heavy amount carried or held.
back_cards.example_en: The truck carried a load of bricks.

back_cards.definition_en: To put something into a device or vehicle.
back_cards.example_en: Load the dishes into the dishwasher.
I have a load of laundry to do.

back_cards.definition_en: To fill or burden with something.
back_cards.example_en: They loaded the schedule with meetings.
Her new job is a heavy load.

back_cards.definition_en: The top covering of a building.
back_cards.example_en: The roof leaked during the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: The upper part of a structure.
back_cards.example_en: We climbed onto the roof to watch fireworks.
They roofed the house with new tiles.
The car’s roof was covered in snow.

back_cards.definition_en: A metaphor for shelter or home.
back_cards.example_en: They kept a roof over their kids’ heads.

back_cards.definition_en: Next to or at the side of.
back_cards.example_en: She sat beside me on the bench.
My skills are nothing beside hers.
The house sits beside a quiet stream.
Beside the cost, time is a factor.

back_cards.definition_en: Near or by the side of.
back_cards.example_en: The dog lay beside the fireplace.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant or part eaten as food.
back_cards.example_en: Carrots are my favorite vegetable.

back_cards.definition_en: A food used in cooking or salads.
back_cards.example_en: The soup is packed with vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant grown for edible parts.
back_cards.example_en: She grows vegetables in her backyard.
Kids should eat more vegetables daily.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for edible plant produce.
back_cards.example_en: The market has fresh vegetables today.
She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.

back_cards.definition_en: To finish or carry out a task.
back_cards.example_en: We accomplished the project ahead of schedule.
He accomplished a lot in his career.

back_cards.definition_en: To fulfill or reach an objective.
back_cards.example_en: They accomplished the mission with teamwork.

back_cards.definition_en: To bring about a desired result.
back_cards.example_en: She accomplished her dream of writing a book.
The room was silent after the speech.

back_cards.definition_en: Not speaking or making a sound.
back_cards.example_en: He stayed silent during the argument.
The forest was silent at dawn.
Her silent disapproval was obvious.
The movie’s silent scene was powerful.
Brushing my teeth is a daily habit.
She has a habit of biting her nails.

back_cards.definition_en: A routine or pattern of action.
back_cards.example_en: Exercise is a habit I’m building.

back_cards.definition_en: A tendency to do something often.
back_cards.example_en: His habit of arriving late annoys everyone.
Quitting smoking was a tough habit to break.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of finding something new.
back_cards.example_en: The discovery of penicillin changed medicine.
Her discovery of the cave was exciting.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of learning something unknown.
back_cards.example_en: Space exploration led to many discoveries.
The scientist’s discovery shocked the world.
His discovery about himself came late.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of getting better after illness.
back_cards.example_en: Her recovery from surgery was quick.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of regaining something lost.
back_cards.example_en: The recovery of the stolen car was a relief.
The economy is in recovery after the downturn.

back_cards.definition_en: Healing from an injury or setback.
back_cards.example_en: His recovery took months of therapy.
Data recovery saved the lost files.
DNA testing confirmed his identity.

back_cards.definition_en: The unique code of an organism.
back_cards.example_en: Her DNA was analyzed for the study.
The lab sequenced the DNA sample.
Hard work is in her DNA.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for scientific or criminal analysis.
back_cards.example_en: DNA evidence solved the cold case.

back_cards.definition_en: An area of land under control.
back_cards.example_en: The wolf pack roamed its territory.
This territory is known for its mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: A domain or field of activity.
back_cards.example_en: Sales is her territory at work.

back_cards.definition_en: Land claimed by a group or nation.
back_cards.example_en: The explorers mapped the new territory.
The territory voted for independence.
He’s taking his girlfriend to the movies.
My girlfriend loves hiking with me.
She’s my girlfriend; we’ve known each other forever.

back_cards.definition_en: A partner in a committed relationship.
back_cards.example_en: His girlfriend moved in last month.

back_cards.definition_en: A term of affection for a female partner.
back_cards.example_en: I got a gift for my girlfriend’s birthday.

back_cards.definition_en: To be made up of or include.
back_cards.example_en: The team consists of five players.

back_cards.definition_en: To have as its parts or elements.
back_cards.example_en: The meal consists of soup and salad.
Her diet consists mainly of vegetables.

back_cards.definition_en: To involve or contain specific parts.
back_cards.example_en: The book consists of three chapters.

back_cards.definition_en: To be based on or rely on.
back_cards.example_en: Success consists of hard work and luck.
Surely you’re not leaving already?
He’ll surely finish the project on time.
This is surely the best pizza ever.

back_cards.definition_en: In a definite or certain way.
back_cards.example_en: She’ll surely call you back soon.

back_cards.definition_en: To express strong belief or expectation.
back_cards.example_en: Surely we can find a solution.
The receipt is proof of your purchase.

back_cards.definition_en: A demonstration of fact or truth.
back_cards.example_en: Her success is proof of her talent.

back_cards.definition_en: The strength of an alcoholic drink.
back_cards.example_en: This whiskey is 80 proof.

back_cards.definition_en: A test or verification of something.
back_cards.example_en: The experiment provided proof of the theory.

back_cards.definition_en: A document or item showing truth.
back_cards.example_en: We need proof of identity to enter.
She was nervous before her speech.
He’s nervous about meeting his new boss.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing signs of tension or fear.
back_cards.example_en: Her nervous smile gave her away.
The injury affected his nervous system.
I get nervous during thunderstorms.
We need immediate action to fix this.

back_cards.definition_en: Very close in time or space.
back_cards.example_en: The immediate area was evacuated.
She gave an immediate response to the question.
My immediate family lives nearby.
The injury needed immediate care.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of leaving a vehicle in a spot.
back_cards.example_en: Finding parking downtown is always tough.

back_cards.definition_en: A space or area for vehicles.
back_cards.example_en: The mall has a huge parking lot.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of stopping a car.
back_cards.example_en: Parallel parking makes me nervous.
There’s no parking near the beach today.

back_cards.definition_en: Rules or systems for vehicle placement.
back_cards.example_en: Parking regulations are strict here.
Lying is considered a sin in many faiths.

back_cards.definition_en: A violation of religious or moral law.
back_cards.example_en: He confessed his sins to the priest.
She felt she sinned by missing church.
Pride is often called the greatest sin.
His greed was his greatest sin.
The weather today is unusual for summer.

back_cards.definition_en: Strange or out of the ordinary.
back_cards.example_en: She wore an unusual hat to the party.
His behavior was unusual for him.
An unusual bird landed in our yard.
The dish had an unusual but tasty flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: A grain used as a staple food.
back_cards.example_en: She cooked rice for dinner tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A common ingredient in many dishes.
back_cards.example_en: The curry tastes great with rice.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant grown in flooded fields.
back_cards.example_en: Rice is harvested in the fall.

back_cards.definition_en: A side dish or main component.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll have rice with my chicken.

back_cards.definition_en: A food staple in many cultures.
back_cards.example_en: Rice is popular in Asian cuisine.

back_cards.definition_en: The field of designing and building.
back_cards.example_en: She studied engineering to design bridges.

back_cards.definition_en: The application of science to create systems.
back_cards.example_en: Engineering drives innovation in tech.

back_cards.definition_en: The profession of creating structures or machines.
back_cards.example_en: He works in engineering for a car company.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of solving technical problems.
back_cards.example_en: Engineering fixed the city’s water system.

back_cards.definition_en: A discipline involving math and science.
back_cards.example_en: Engineering requires strong problem-solving skills.
The team advanced to the finals.
This technology will advance our research.
The new law is a major advance.

back_cards.definition_en: To pay or lend money early.
back_cards.example_en: They advanced her salary for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To propose or suggest ahead of time.
back_cards.example_en: She advanced a bold new idea.

back_cards.definition_en: To put something in the ground.
back_cards.example_en: They buried the treasure on the island.
She buried her face in her hands.

back_cards.definition_en: To place a body in a grave.
back_cards.example_en: They buried their grandfather last week.
He buried himself in his studies.
She buried her feelings to stay strong.
I made a chocolate cake for the party.
She served a crab cake appetizer.
This job is a piece of cake.
The wedding cake was three tiers tall.
The kids loved the birthday cake.

back_cards.definition_en: Without a known name or identity.
back_cards.example_en: The donation was made by an anonymous donor.
She posted an anonymous review online.
The poem was written by an anonymous poet.
He sent an anonymous tip to the police.
The call came from an anonymous source.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of fabric representing a group.
back_cards.example_en: The flag waved proudly above the school.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of a country or organization.
back_cards.example_en: She saluted the flag during the ceremony.
I flagged the email for follow-up.

back_cards.definition_en: A sign or indicator of something.
back_cards.example_en: His absence is a red flag for us.
She flagged down a taxi on the street.
Contemporary art is displayed in the gallery.
Her work is contemporary with his research.

back_cards.definition_en: A person living in the same era.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a contemporary of famous writers.
The house has a contemporary design.

back_cards.definition_en: Of the present time or period.
back_cards.example_en: Contemporary issues dominate the news.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where prisoners are held.
back_cards.example_en: He was sent to jail for theft.

back_cards.definition_en: To imprison or lock someone up.
back_cards.example_en: They jailed the suspect after the trial.
The county jail is overcrowded.

back_cards.definition_en: A place of confinement for offenders.
back_cards.example_en: She visited her brother in jail.
He spent a week in jail last year.
They live in a rural area with farms.

back_cards.definition_en: Away from cities or urban areas.
back_cards.example_en: Rural life is quiet and peaceful.
The rural community grows its own food.
Rural roads can be hard to navigate.
Her rural upbringing shaped her values.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of explaining or understanding something.
back_cards.example_en: Her interpretation of the poem was unique.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of understanding or translating.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer’s interpretation of the law was clear.

back_cards.definition_en: A performance or rendition of art.
back_cards.example_en: His interpretation of the song was emotional.
The data’s interpretation led to new insights.
Her interpretation of the event differed.
Her wage barely covers her expenses.
The company raised the minimum wage.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry out or engage in.
back_cards.example_en: They waged a campaign against pollution.
His wage increased after the promotion.
Workers demanded a fair wage.

back_cards.definition_en: The first meal of the day.
back_cards.example_en: I had cereal for breakfast today.

back_cards.definition_en: A morning meal to start the day.
back_cards.example_en: She makes breakfast for her kids daily.
Pancakes are my favorite breakfast.

back_cards.definition_en: A meal breaking the night’s fast.
back_cards.example_en: We enjoyed a big breakfast at the diner.
Breakfast is served until 10 AM.
The storm caused severe damage to the town.
The teacher gave a severe warning.
He suffered from severe back pain.
The hike was severe but rewarding.
Severe weather delayed the flight.

back_cards.definition_en: A description or summary of someone.
back_cards.example_en: Her profile on the app was impressive.

back_cards.definition_en: A side view, especially of a face.
back_cards.example_en: The artist sketched her profile perfectly.
He updated his social media profile.

back_cards.definition_en: An outline or overview of something.
back_cards.example_en: The report gave a profile of the company.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of characteristics or data.
back_cards.example_en: The job fits her professional profile.

back_cards.definition_en: Money set aside for future use.
back_cards.example_en: Her savings are enough for a car.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of preserving or storing.
back_cards.example_en: Saving energy helps the environment.

back_cards.definition_en: A reduction in cost or expense.
back_cards.example_en: The sale offered a big saving.

back_cards.definition_en: Money kept in a bank or account.
back_cards.example_en: He’s been saving for a vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of keeping something safe.
back_cards.example_en: Saving the old tree was a victory.
The meeting was brief but productive.
She gave a brief of the project.
The boss briefed us on the plan.
His brief answer cleared up the confusion.

back_cards.definition_en: A short legal or official document.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer filed a brief for the case.

back_cards.definition_en: To change or adapt something slightly.
back_cards.example_en: I need to adjust the chair’s height.

back_cards.definition_en: To get used to a new situation.
back_cards.example_en: She adjusted to city life quickly.
He adjusted the settings on the TV.

back_cards.definition_en: To alter for better fit or function.
back_cards.example_en: They adjusted the schedule for flexibility.
We’ll adjust our plans if it rains.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of making something smaller.
back_cards.example_en: The store announced a price reduction.

back_cards.definition_en: A decrease in amount or size.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a reduction in traffic today.
The recipe calls for a sauce reduction.

back_cards.definition_en: A cut in quantity or value.
back_cards.example_en: The budget reduction affected hiring.
A reduction in stress improved her health.

back_cards.definition_en: Happening all the time or regularly.
back_cards.example_en: She’s constantly checking her phone.
The machine runs constantly during the day.
He’s constantly late for meetings.

back_cards.definition_en: In a steady or continuous way.
back_cards.example_en: The kids are constantly asking questions.
The rain fell constantly all afternoon.
I’ll assist you with your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: To aid in a task or process.
back_cards.example_en: She assisted the team in finishing early.
The nurse assisted the doctor during surgery.
He assisted in organizing the event.
Volunteers assisted with the cleanup.

back_cards.definition_en: A vulgar term for a mean woman.
back_cards.example_en: She called her a bitch after the argument.
Stop bitching about the cold weather.

back_cards.definition_en: A derogatory term for a woman.
back_cards.example_en: He insulted her by calling her a bitch.
That test was a real bitch to pass.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express frustration or annoyance.
back_cards.example_en: This broken lock is such a bitch.
The constant noise kept me awake.
Her constant support was comforting.
He’s under constant pressure at work.
The constant in the equation is 5.
The constant rain ruined our plans.
The teacher permitted us to leave early.
You need a permit to park here.
The weather permits us to hike today.

back_cards.definition_en: A license for a specific activity.
back_cards.example_en: He got a fishing permit for the lake.
The law permits smoking in this area.

back_cards.definition_en: Mainly or for the most part.
back_cards.example_en: She’s primarily responsible for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Chiefly or in the first place.
back_cards.example_en: The event is primarily for students.
The store sells primarily organic food.
His role is primarily to advise the team.
The book is primarily about leadership.
The festival offered great entertainment.

back_cards.definition_en: The industry of shows and media.
back_cards.example_en: She works in entertainment as a producer.
Movies are my favorite form of entertainment.
Live music is the evening’s entertainment.
The party had entertainment for all ages.

back_cards.definition_en: To yell or call out loudly.
back_cards.example_en: She shouted to get his attention.
His shout echoed through the valley.

back_cards.definition_en: To speak in a loud voice.
back_cards.example_en: Don’t shout; I can hear you fine.
The crowd’s shout cheered the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To express loudly or with force.
back_cards.example_en: He shouted his excitement about the win.
She attends a military academy.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of experts or scholars.
back_cards.example_en: The academy awarded her for her research.

back_cards.definition_en: An institution for learning or arts.
back_cards.example_en: The film academy hosts annual events.
He graduated from the police academy.

back_cards.definition_en: A society for professionals or academics.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a member of the science academy.

back_cards.definition_en: A small spoon for measuring or eating.
back_cards.example_en: Add a teaspoon of sugar to the mix.

back_cards.definition_en: A unit of measurement in cooking.
back_cards.example_en: The recipe calls for two teaspoons of salt.

back_cards.definition_en: A utensil used for stirring drinks.
back_cards.example_en: She stirred her tea with a teaspoon.

back_cards.definition_en: A small amount of an ingredient.
back_cards.example_en: A teaspoon of vanilla makes it perfect.

back_cards.definition_en: A household spoon for small portions.
back_cards.example_en: Use a teaspoon to scoop the spices.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: I’ll transfer the files to your computer.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of moving or handing over.
back_cards.example_en: The transfer of power was peaceful.

back_cards.definition_en: To switch to a different place or role.
back_cards.example_en: She transferred to a new school.

back_cards.definition_en: A ticket or pass for travel.
back_cards.example_en: This transfer lets you ride another bus.
He transferred to the night shift.

back_cards.definition_en: Normal or typical; what is expected.
back_cards.example_en: She ordered her usual coffee this morning.
The usual crowd was at the bar.
He’s late, as usual, for the meeting.
The usual rules apply to this game.
It was the usual busy day at work.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or group that supports another.
back_cards.example_en: She’s been a loyal ally in tough times.

back_cards.definition_en: A country or group in partnership.
back_cards.example_en: The nations became allies during the war.
He’s an ally in our fight for justice.

back_cards.definition_en: A supporter in a cause or effort.
back_cards.example_en: The organization found allies in the community.
They allied with the team to win.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to medical treatment or observation.
back_cards.example_en: The clinical trial tested a new drug.
Her clinical skills saved the patient.
His analysis was clinical and precise.
She gained clinical experience in the hospital.
The study was conducted in a clinical setting.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a solemn promise or oath.
back_cards.example_en: I swear I’ll finish the project on time.

back_cards.definition_en: To use bad or offensive language.
back_cards.example_en: He swore when he stubbed his toe.
She swore to keep the secret safe.
The coach swore at the referee’s call.
I swear I saw him at the store.
The parade marched down Main Avenue.

back_cards.definition_en: A way or path to achieve something.
back_cards.example_en: This job is an avenue to success.
The avenue was lined with old oaks.

back_cards.definition_en: A route or option for progress.
back_cards.example_en: They explored every avenue to solve it.
Her office is on Fifth Avenue.

back_cards.definition_en: A religious leader in certain faiths.
back_cards.example_en: The priest led the Sunday service.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who performs sacred rites.
back_cards.example_en: The priest blessed the new church.
She spoke to the priest about her worries.
The priest officiated the wedding ceremony.
The priest wore traditional robes.

back_cards.definition_en: The state of having a job.
back_cards.example_en: She found employment at a tech firm.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of hiring or working.
back_cards.example_en: Employment opportunities are growing here.
His employment keeps him busy.

back_cards.definition_en: The use or engagement of services.
back_cards.example_en: The company offers part-time employment.
Employment rates improved this year.

back_cards.definition_en: To rest or become less tense.
back_cards.example_en: I like to relax with a good book.
She relaxed after the exam was over.

back_cards.definition_en: To make less strict or rigid.
back_cards.example_en: They relaxed the rules for the event.
He relaxed by the pool all day.

back_cards.definition_en: To ease up or take it easy.
back_cards.example_en: Just relax; everything will be fine.

back_cards.definition_en: To be in debt to someone.
back_cards.example_en: I owe her twenty bucks for lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: To have an obligation to pay.
back_cards.example_en: He owes taxes from last year.
I owe my success to my parents.

back_cards.definition_en: To have a duty or responsibility.
back_cards.example_en: She owes him an apology for being late.

back_cards.definition_en: To need to repay or return.
back_cards.example_en: You owe me a favor after this.

back_cards.definition_en: To change completely in form or nature.
back_cards.example_en: The renovation transformed the old house.
She transformed her diet to get healthier.
The app transformed how we communicate.
The company transformed into a tech giant.
They transformed the park into a venue.

back_cards.definition_en: A common green plant covering ground.
back_cards.example_en: The grass in the yard needs mowing.
Kids played soccer on the grass.
He got caught smoking grass.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface for sports or recreation.
back_cards.example_en: The game was played on wet grass.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant used for grazing or lawns.
back_cards.example_en: The farmer planted new grass for the cows.
The narrow path led to the river.
Her interests are quite narrow.
He won by a narrow margin.

back_cards.definition_en: To reduce in width or extent.
back_cards.example_en: They narrowed the road for repairs.
The narrow hallway felt cramped.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a cultural or racial group.
back_cards.example_en: The festival celebrated ethnic traditions.
She wore an ethnic dress to the event.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to a distinct cultural identity.
back_cards.example_en: The market sells ethnic foods from Asia.
The city has a rich ethnic diversity.

back_cards.definition_en: Of or about a group’s culture.
back_cards.example_en: Ethnic music filled the concert hall.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who studies or researches.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a scholar of ancient history.
The scholar published a new book.
He’s a scholar at the university.
The scholar spent hours in the library.

back_cards.definition_en: An expert in a specific field.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a respected scholar in biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A version of a published work.
back_cards.example_en: I have the first edition of that book.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific issue of a publication.
back_cards.example_en: The Sunday edition had great articles.
This is the deluxe edition of the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A copy or print of something.
back_cards.example_en: The new edition includes updated data.

back_cards.definition_en: A variant of an original work.
back_cards.example_en: The revised edition fixed the errors.

back_cards.definition_en: To leave or give up completely.
back_cards.example_en: They had to abandon the sinking ship.
She abandoned her old car in the lot.

back_cards.definition_en: To stop pursuing a goal or plan.
back_cards.example_en: He abandoned his dream of acting.

back_cards.definition_en: To leave behind with no intent to return.
back_cards.example_en: The town was abandoned after the flood.

back_cards.definition_en: To give up control or restraint.
back_cards.example_en: She danced with wild abandon.

back_cards.definition_en: Useful or effective in real situations.
back_cards.example_en: Her advice was practical and helpful.

back_cards.definition_en: Focused on actual use or application.
back_cards.example_en: The course teaches practical skills for work.
He took a practical approach to the problem.
The bag is practical for everyday use.
We need a practical solution now.

back_cards.definition_en: A disease caused by germs or bacteria.
back_cards.example_en: The cut led to a bad infection.
Antibiotics treated her lung infection.
The infection spread quickly in the school.
His infection required immediate treatment.
Proper hygiene prevents infection.
She starred in a popular musical.

back_cards.definition_en: A play or film with songs.
back_cards.example_en: The musical had amazing dance numbers.
Her voice is so musical and soothing.
He’s a musical genius on the piano.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to the art of music.
back_cards.example_en: The festival showcased musical talent.
Her suggestion for the party was great.
There was a suggestion of rain in the air.
I’m open to suggestions for dinner.
His suggestion saved us a lot of time.
The teacher’s suggestion improved my essay.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of opposing or fighting back.
back_cards.example_en: The resistance to the new law was strong.

back_cards.definition_en: A force that opposes motion or change.
back_cards.example_en: The bike’s tires met resistance on the hill.
Her resistance to colds is impressive.
The resistance hid in the mountains.

back_cards.definition_en: Opposition to an idea or force.
back_cards.example_en: There’s resistance to changing the policy.

back_cards.definition_en: The vapor or gas from burning.
back_cards.example_en: Smoke filled the room after the fire.
He smokes a cigarette every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: A cloud of particles in the air.
back_cards.example_en: The campfire’s smoke stung my eyes.
They smoked the fish for flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: To move or act quickly, informally.
back_cards.example_en: She smoked past us on her bike.

back_cards.definition_en: A male member of a royal family.
back_cards.example_en: The prince attended the royal ball.

back_cards.definition_en: A son of a king or queen.
back_cards.example_en: The prince is next in line for the throne.
He’s a prince for helping me out.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader or ruler in a field.
back_cards.example_en: He’s a prince of the music industry.

back_cards.definition_en: A character in stories or fairy tales.
back_cards.example_en: The prince rescued the lost traveler.
Her illness kept her home for weeks.
He’s recovering from a serious illness.
The illness caused her to miss work.
Doctors are studying her rare illness.
Mental illness affects many people silently.

back_cards.definition_en: To hug or hold someone affectionately.
back_cards.example_en: She embraced her friend after years apart.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept or adopt something willingly.
back_cards.example_en: He embraced the new company culture.
Their warm embrace showed their bond.

back_cards.definition_en: To take up or support an idea.
back_cards.example_en: They embraced the plan to save energy.
Her speech embraced all viewpoints.

back_cards.definition_en: A government run by elected officials.
back_cards.example_en: The country became a republic after the vote.

back_cards.definition_en: A state with a non-monarch leader.
back_cards.example_en: The republic elected a new president.
The republic’s laws protect free speech.

back_cards.definition_en: A nation with a democratic structure.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a citizen of the republic.

back_cards.definition_en: A political entity without a king.
back_cards.example_en: The republic celebrates its independence day.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who offers help freely.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a volunteer at the animal shelter.
He volunteered to clean up the park.
The volunteers helped serve meals.

back_cards.definition_en: To take part in unpaid work.
back_cards.example_en: I volunteer at the library every weekend.
Volunteers made the event a success.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of assessing or judging something.
back_cards.example_en: The evaluation of the project was positive.

back_cards.definition_en: A review or analysis of performance.
back_cards.example_en: Her job evaluation went really well.
The evaluation of the car took hours.
The teacher’s evaluation helped us improve.
The evaluation showed areas for growth.
Her opinion is the opposite of mine.
The store is opposite the park.

back_cards.definition_en: A thing that is contrary or different.
back_cards.example_en: Big is the opposite of small.
He sat opposite me at the table.
They always do the opposite of what’s asked.
That concert was absolutely awesome!
The new game is totally awesome.
Her performance was awesome to watch.
The view from the mountain was awesome.
You did an awesome job on this!
